docs.title: Inquirer Textual
docs.text: Versatile library for terminal user input in Python

docs.title: About
docs.text:
All terminal programs start small. Some stay small, and some become incredibly big. The goal of this Python library is to make user input simple for small programs, but also support a smooth transition to a comprehensive UI library as your program grows.

This library is based on the sophisticated Textual TUI framework.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
The Python code for the example above:

from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.checkbox("Planets:", choices=[
        'Mercury', 'Venus', 'Earth', 'Mars', 'Jupiter', 'Saturn', 
        'Uranus', 'Neptune'
    ])
    print(answer)

With uv you can run the example out of the box:

uv run --with inquirer-textual checkbox.py

docs.title: Key features and design principles
docs.text:
• Keep simple things simple: High-level prompts API for getting user input
  • Support evolving programs: From small scripts to full-featured TUI applications
  • Inquirer-like syntax: API similar to many other Inquirer libraries
  • Single dependency: The Textual TUI framework

docs.title: Checkbox
docs.text: A checkbox widget that allows multiple selections from a list of choices.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.checkbox("Planets:", choices=[
        'Mercury', 'Venus', 'Earth', 'Mars', 'Jupiter', 'Saturn', 
        'Uranus', 'Neptune'
    ])
    print(answer)

docs.title: Confirm
docs.text: A confirmation prompt that allows the user to confirm or reject.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.confirm("Proceed?")
    print(answer)

docs.title: Multi
docs.text: A prompt that allows the user to answer multiple prompts in sequence.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts
from inquirer_textual.widgets.InquirerCheckbox import InquirerCheckbox
from inquirer_textual.widgets.InquirerConfirm import InquirerConfirm
from inquirer_textual.widgets.InquirerNumber import InquirerNumber
from inquirer_textual.widgets.InquirerSecret import InquirerSecret
from inquirer_textual.widgets.InquirerText import InquirerText
from inquirer_textual.widgets.InquirerSelect import InquirerSelect

if __name__ == '__main__':
    text_widget = InquirerText('Name:')
    password_widget = InquirerSecret('Password:')
    number_widget = InquirerNumber('Memory:')
    confirm_widget = InquirerConfirm('Proceed?')
    select_widget = InquirerSelect('Planet?', ['Earth', 'Mars', 'Venus'], default='Mars')
    checkbox_widget = InquirerCheckbox("People?", choices=['Alice', 'Bob', 'Charlie'])
    answer = prompts.multi(
        [text_widget, password_widget, number_widget, confirm_widget, select_widget, checkbox_widget])
    print(answer)

docs.title: Number
docs.text: A number input widget that allows the user to input a numerical value.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.number(message='Memory:')
    print(answer)

docs.title: Secret
docs.text: A secret input prompt that allows the user to enter a secret value (e.g., password).

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.secret('Password:')
    print(answer)

docs.title: Select
docs.text: A select widget that allows a single selection from a list of choices.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.select('Planet:', ['Mercury', 'Venus', 'Earth', 'Mars', 
        'Jupiter', 'Saturn', 'Uranus', 'Neptune'], mandatory=False)
    print(answer)

docs.title: Text
docs.text: A text input prompt that allows the user to enter a string.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
from inquirer_textual import prompts

if __name__ == '__main__':
    answer = prompts.text('Name:')
    print(answer)
